channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MN

item.title: Report X-2024040788
item.description:
Report X-2024040788

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-12
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: damaged hazmat was discovered during van pickups. The package had received a code 4 and been brought back to the station. It does not have a code 10 or code 15 to indicate when damage was initially discovered prior to return to station. The QA admin doing van pickups placed it in a lined tote, brought it to the damage area, and placed it atop the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. DescribePack: one bottle leaked from loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

item.title: Report X-2024040585
item.description:
Report X-2024040585

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-05
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: driver placed a code 10 on the package. either the driver left the package at the station (but no Removed From Vehicle scan) or returned to the station relatively soon with it, because less than an hour after the code 10, a QA admin placed a code 39 on the tracking ID. QA admin put the damaged package in a lined tote. he brought it back to the damage area and moved it to the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. DescribePack: one bottle leaked due to loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: damaged package was discovered this morning on the inbound. someone placed it in a lined tote, brought it to the damage area, and moved it to the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. DescribePack: the tape covering the bottom flaps was loose, allowing the bottles to fall out. one of them leaked a small amount of powder. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

item.title: Report X-2024040344
item.description:
Report X-2024040344

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-16T18:13:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-28
  • City: SHAKOPEE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver alerted management of a leaking hazmat package on van. Management alerted hazmat admin. The package was in the back of van on the floor away from other packages and leaking. The leaking package was put in a hazmat bin. The box fell apart when trying to put it in the bin. There was some minor leakage to the corner of a package but it was dried and sent on. The rest of the spill was cleaned with absorbent cloth. DescribePack: One of the bottles in the box was severely dented and was leaking from the cap. The bottle appeared to be about 25% full at the time of the inspection. The box was very wet and fell apart upon lifting it into the hazmat bin. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: The package was put in a hazmat bin and the remaining liquid was cleaned with the hazmat absorbent cloth.
